Legal_Issue: Did the Board err in failing to perform a separate analysis under section 97 of the IRPA?
Evidence_Assessment: Documentary evidence showing persecution of CUD members
Legal_Rule: Under section 97 of the IRPA, the Board must assess if removal would subject the claimant to torture, risk to life, or cruel and unusual treatment.
Procedural_Issue: Failure to conduct separate analysis under section 97
Grounds_for_Claim: Political persecution due to CUD membership in Ethiopia
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board failed to analyze required risks under section 97
Key_Evidence_Considered: Membership in CUD, documentary evidence of persecution
Applicant_Challenge: Board did not assess risk under section 97 despite accepted membership and evidence
Court_Result: Case remanded for redetermination under section 97
Outcome: Case referred back for reassessment under section 97
Remedy_Sought: Remittal for proper analysis under section 97
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Risk of torture, risk to life, cruel and unusual treatment upon removal
Governing_Rule: Section 97 of the IRPA requires assessment of risk to life, torture, or cruel and unusual treatment upon removal
